sections.heading: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Music and Musicians Tax Credit and Jobs Act. References in this Article to "this Act" mean this Article.
sections.text: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Music and Musicians Tax Credit and Jobs Act. References in this Article to "this Act" mean this Article.

sections.heading: Purpose. The State's economy depends heavily on music, professional musicians, music teachers, and educators
sections.text: Illinois is a cultural crown jewel of the United States. Illinois and Chicago boast a robust history and community of creative artists, writers, musicians, architects, orchestras, live music

sections.heading: Definitions. As used in this Act:
sections.text: Definitions. As used in this Act:

sections.heading: Powers of the Department. The Department, in addition to those powers granted under the Civil Administrative Code of Illinois, is granted and has all the powers necessary or convenient to carry out and effectuate the purposes and provisions of this Act, including, but not limited to, the power and a
sections.text: Powers of the Department. The Department, in addition to those powers granted under the Civil Administrative Code of Illinois, is granted and has all the powers necessary or convenient to carry out and effectuate the purposes and provisions of this Act, including, but not limited to, the power and authority to:

sections.heading: Application for certification of qualified music company
sections.text: Any applicant who operates or is proposing to operate a business in the State may apply to the Department to have the business certified by the Department as a qualified music company if the business meets the criteria for certification set f

sections.heading: Review of applications for qualified music company certificates.
sections.text: Review of applications for qualified music company certificates.

sections.heading: Training programs for skills in critical demand
sections.text: To accomplish the purposes of this Act, the Department may use the training programs provided under Section 605-800 of the Department of Commerce and Economic Opportunity Law of the Civil Administrative Code of Illinois.

sections.heading: Issuance of tax credit award certificate.
sections.text: Issuance of tax credit award certificate.

sections.heading: Amount and payment of the tax credit award.
sections.text: Amount and payment of the tax credit award.

sections.heading: Qualified music program evaluation and reports.
sections.text: Qualified music program evaluation and reports.

sections.heading: Program terms and conditions. Any documentary materials or data made available or received from an applicant by any agent or employee of the Department are confidential and are not public records to the extent that the materials or data consist of commercial or financial information regarding the op
sections.text: Program terms and conditions. Any documentary materials or data made available or received from an applicant by any agent or employee of the Department are confidential and are not public records to the extent that the materials or data consist of commercial or financial information regarding the operation of or the production of the applicant or recipient of any tax credit award under this Act.

sections.heading: No acceleration or delay. Where this Act makes changes in a statute that is represented in this Act by text that is not yet or no longer in effect (for example, a Section represented by multiple versions), the use of that text does not accelerate or delay the taking effect of (i) the changes made by
sections.text: No acceleration or delay. Where this Act makes changes in a statute that is represented in this Act by text that is not yet or no longer in effect (for example, a Section represented by multiple versions), the use of that text does not accelerate or delay the taking effect of (i) the changes made by this Act or (ii) provisions derived from any other Public Act.

sections.heading: Severability. The provisions of this Act are severable under Section 1.31 of the Statute on Statutes.
sections.text: Severability. The provisions of this Act are severable under Section 1.31 of the Statute on Statutes.

sections.heading: Effective date. This Act takes effect upon becoming law, except that Article 65 takes effect July 1, 2024, Articles 25, 75, 80, 93, 125, 135, and 140 take effect January 1, 2025, and Article 150 takes effect July 1, 2025
sections.text: Effective date. This Act takes effect upon becoming law, except that Article 65 takes effect July 1, 2024, Articles 25, 75, 80, 93, 125, 135, and 140 take effect January 1, 2025, and Article 150 takes effect July 1, 2025.
